main event: A bright light was observed in the sky over Baffin Island, Canada, which was described as a 'standing flash or light'.
interesting points: The object was only observed for a brief period of time, approximately 3 seconds.
The report indicates the description is typical of a meteor.
It was observed by an aircraft (DC3) at 10,000 feet, flying at 140 knots.
Weather conditions included scattered to broken stratocumulus clouds and moist, stable air.
The report mentions a previous aircraft incident in the same general area on October 10, 1953, where the aircraft and crew were lost.
sighted object: a bright light in the sky
